   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: -module(port_call_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
   25: %%% Checks if the dynamic driver and linker loader works.
   26: %%%
   27: %%% These tests can only be run installed (outside clearcase).
   28: %%%
   29: %%% XXX In this suite is missing test cases for reference counts
   30: %%% and that drivers are unloaded when their processes die.
   31: %%% (For me to add :-)
   32: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
   33: 
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   36:          init_per_testcase/2,
   37:          basic/1]).
   38: 
   39: % Private exports
   40: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   41: 
   42: suite() ->
   43:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   44:      {timetrap, {seconds, 10}}].
   45: 
   46: all() -> 
   47:     [basic].
   48: 
   49: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   50:     runner:init_per_testcase(?MODULE, Case, Config).
   51: 
   52: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   53:     case os:type() of
   54:         {unix, linux} ->
   55:             do_basic(Config);
   56:         {unix, sunos} ->
   57:             do_basic(Config);
   58:         {win32,_} ->
   59:             do_basic(Config);
   60:         _ ->
   61:             {skipped, "Dynamic linking and erl_interface not fully examined"
   62:                       " on this platform..."}
   63:     end.
   64: 
   65: do_basic(Config) ->
   66:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   67: 
   68:     erl_ddll:start(),
   69: 
   70:     %% Load the echo driver and verify that it was loaded.
   71:     {ok,L1,L2}=load_port_call_driver(Path),
   72: 
   73:     %% Verify that the driver works.
   74: 
   75:     Port = open_port({spawn, port_call_drv}, [eof]),
   76:     {hej, "hopp",4711,123445567436543653} =
   77:         erlang:port_call(Port,{hej, "hopp",4711,123445567436543653}),
   78:     {hej, "hopp",4711,123445567436543653} =
   79:         erlang:port_call(Port,0,{hej, "hopp",4711,123445567436543653}),
   80:     {[], a, [], b, c} =
   81:         erlang:port_call(Port,1,{hej, "hopp",4711,123445567436543653}),
   82:     {return, {[], a, [], b, c}} =
   83:         erlang:port_call(Port,2,{[], a, [], b, c}),
   84:     List = lists:duplicate(200,5),
   85:     {return, List} = erlang:port_call(Port,2,List),
   86:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:port_call(Port,4711,[])),
   87:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:port_call(sune,2,[])),
   88:     register(gunnar,Port),
   89:     {return, List} = erlang:port_call(gunnar,2,List),
   90:     {return, a} = erlang:port_call(gunnar,2,a),
   91:     erlang:port_close(Port),
   92:     %% Unload the driver and verify that it was unloaded.
   93:     ok=unload_port_call_driver(L1,L2),
   94: 
   95:     {error, {already_started, _}} = erl_ddll:start(),
   96:     ok = erl_ddll:stop(),
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: load_port_call_driver(Path) ->
  100:     {ok, L1} = erl_ddll:loaded_drivers(),
  101:     ok = erl_ddll:load_driver(Path, port_call_drv),
  102:     {ok, L2} = erl_ddll:loaded_drivers(),
  103:     ["port_call_drv"] = ordsets:to_list(ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(L2),
  104:                                                          ordsets:from_list(L1))),
  105:     {ok,L1,L2}.
  106: 
  107: unload_port_call_driver(L1,L2) ->
  108:     {ok, L2} = erl_ddll:loaded_drivers(),
  109:     ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(port_call_drv),
  110:     {ok, L3} = erl_ddll:loaded_drivers(),
  111:     [] = ordsets:to_list(ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(L3),
  112:                                           ordsets:from_list(L1))),
  113:     ok.
